definition: appropriate to any place and any time (idiom); universally applicable/a panacea
pinyin: fang4 zhi1 si4 hai3 er2 jie1 zhun3
fang4 zhi1 si4 hai3 er2 jie1 zhun3

definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)
ocean/sea/CL:個|个[ge4],片[pian4]/great number of people or things/(dialect) numerous
and/as well as/and so/but (not)/yet (not)/(indicates causal relation)/(indicates change of state)/(indicates contrast)
to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of

sentences.english: I’m personally not a supporter of ‘one size fits all’ approach.
sentences.chinese: 我个人并不认为有一种放之四海而皆准的方案。

sentences.english: First, there is no one size fits all model for agriculture.
sentences.chinese: 首先，没有一个放之四海而皆准的农业模式。

sentences.english: There are no universal right answers when it comes to building our businesses.
sentences.chinese: 要开创自己的事业，没有放之四海而皆准的正确做法。

definition: methodology/Discours de la méthode by René Descartes 笛卡兒|笛卡儿[Di2 ka3 er2], 1637
to copy a set pattern mechanically/to crib
scientific law (e.g. law of conservation of energy)/(in human affairs) a generalization based on observation (e.g. "power corrupts")
easy to grasp but difficult to put into practice (idiom)/easier said than done
many superficial changes but no departure from the original stand (idiom); plus ça change, plus ça reste la mème chose
pinyin: wan4 bian4 bu4 li2 qi2 zong1
